data.title: Clippers officially sign Raymond Felton
data.meta_description: The Clippers officially signed veteran point guard Raymond Felton to a deal for the veteran’s minimum. Felton, 32, spent the last two seasons with the Dallas Mavericks, getting his career back on track last season as a valuable member of the Dallas bench. data.text:
The Clippers officially signed veteran point guard Raymond Felton to a deal for the veteran’s minimum.

Felton, 32, spent the last two seasons with the Dallas Mavericks, getting his career back on track last season as a valuable member of the Dallas bench. In 80 games (31 starts), Felton averaged 9.5 points, 3.6 assists and 3.2 rebounds. He averaged 15 points, 4.6 rebounds and 4.6 assists in the Mavericks’ five playoffs games.

The 11-year NBA veteran holds career averages of 12.4 points, 3.2 rebounds and 6 assists in 776 games (646 starts) with the Charlotte Hornets, New York Knicks, Denver Nuggets, Portland Trail Blazers and Mavericks. He was named NBA All-Rookie Second Team in 2006.

Felton had agreed nearly two weeks ago.
